attributes.description:
This project is part of the MBTA initiative to bring the Green Line track into a state of good repair.

Riders should anticipate an extra 20 minutes of travel time. All shuttle bus stops are fully accessible.

Shuttles begin at 8:30 PM on the following Fridays:
March 29
April 5

Affected stops:
Kenmore
Saint Marys Street

attributes.description:
If exiting at Central Square, continue to Kendall Station and utilize free shuttle bus service to Central Square. The shuttle pick-up location is on Main St. near the station entrance for the Alewife platform. Please see station personnel or utilize a station call box to request the shuttle. 

If boarding at Central Square, utilize free shuttle bus for service to Kendall Station. The shuttle pick-up location is on Massachusetts Ave. near Elevator 861. Please see station personnel or utilize the station call box at street-level to request the shuttle.

attributes.description:
Access to the Kendall/MIT Station will remain open and accessible on the Main Street side of the station throughout this construction.
 
The pedestrian plaza between Carleton Street and Main Street in Kendall Square will be closed due to the construction of an underground garage. 
 
Customers are encouraged to utilize alternative paths to/from the station using the paths on Ames Street, Dock Street, or Wadsworth Street.

Affected routes:
Red Line

attributes.description:

attributes.description:
Additional weekends may be added as work progresses.

Inbound Service:

Passengers going to Boston from stops between Lowell and Anderson will take the train as far as Anderson and then transfer to buses.

Those going to local stations (not North Station), will continue on the train which will terminate at West Medford.

Passengers boarding at stations south of Anderson will ride the train to West Medford and then transfer to a bus shuttle at West Medford which will go to North Station. 

Outbound Service:

For passengers departing Boston for stations between Anderson/Woburn and Lowell, an express bus will run from North Station to Anderson/Woburn where riders will connect to train service.

Those departing Boston for stations south of Anderson/Woburn will take bus shuttles between North Station and their destination station. 

Passengers travelling directly from stations between West Medford and Anderson/Woburn will board the train which will run from West Medford outbound to Lowell making all stops on the normal train schedule.
attributes.header: Weekends,3/23- 4/28, Lowell service will be partially replaced by shuttles. Riders between Lowell & Anderson will transfer at Anderson for express bus service to/from N. Station. Those between Winchester & W. Medford will shuttle to/from W. Medford.

attributes.description:
We are working with our vendor to solve GPS tracking on D branch trains in the Newton area. We have deactivated countdown clocks at some D branch stations so that we are not providing incorrect predictions.

Thank you for your patience as we work to resolve this issue.

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, north and southbound lanes and ramps will be closed in Chelsea. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428. 

For the Route 111, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Customers may show their CharlieCard to the conductor for travel between Chelsea and North Station, a 10-minute trip. Parking is not available at Chelsea Station. 

Silver Line - SL3: SL3 connects to the Blue Line (via Airport Station), Red Line (via South Station), and the Commuter Rail at Chelsea Station, along with other Silver Line routes. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Inbound SL3 fares are being waived from Chelsea, Bellingham Square, Box District, and Eastern Ave during construction. 

Subway: For Blue Line service, take bus Routes 114, 116, or 117 to Maverick or the SL3 to Airport Station. For Red Line, take the SL3 to South Station. For Orange Line, take the Routes 110 or 112 to Wellington. Monthly LinkPasses are valid for travel on the SL3 and subway. Monthly local bus passes are not accepted on SL3 or subway. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Beginning Monday, April 1, expect major delays on the Route 111 due to lane closures in both directions on Route 1 in Chelsea and Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek alternate routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge

attributes.description:
Customers looking to exit the Red Line at Andrew should exit at Broadway and utilize a station call box or see station personnel to request shuttle bus service to Andrew. Shuttle bus pick-up is located on the Dorchester Avenue side of Broadway Station. Customers looking to board at Andrew should utilize shuttle bus service to Broadway to make Red Line connections. 

The elevators are being taken out of service to facilitate a full replacement of the elevator lifts, hydraulics, and electrical systems.

attributes.description:
Headways:
This diversion may result in slightly longer headways. Riders should plan for an additional 20 minutes of travel time.
- Southbound trains depart Harvard about every 10 minutes.
- Northbound trains depart Ashmont & Braintree about every 20 minutes. 

Diversion:
Bus shuttles replace train service between Harvard and Alewife in both directions on weekends from start to end of service. The diversion allows crews to perform necessary rail, tie, and track work. All shuttles are fully accessible. Regular train service resumes at start of service Monday.
Shuttling occurs on the following weekends:
- March 30 - 31
- April 6 - 7
- April 20* (Saturday only)
- April 27 - 28
Affected Stations: Harvard, Porter, Davis & Alewife
attributes.header: Shuttle buses replace Red Line service between Harvard and Alewife on weekends through April 28, excluding April 13-14, due to track work. Expand this alert for headway information. MBTA.com/RLtracks

attributes.description:
Due to MassDOT's Tobin Bridge/Chelsea Curves Rehabilitation Project, north and southbound lanes and ramps will be closed on Route 1 in Chelsea. We expect this work will cause significant delays to buses on these roads, including Routes 111, 426, and 428. 

For the Routes 426 & 428, alternate service options include: 
Commuter Rail: For service to downtown Boston and connections to the Green and Orange Lines. Lynn Station (Zone 2 fare) is a 20-minute trip to North Station and daily parking is available for $2. 

Bus Routes: Inner Express Bus Routes 424, 434, 450, 459 or local bus Route 455 connect to downtown Boston and the Orange & Green Lines. Monthly Inner Express Bus passes are valid on these routes and local bus routes/subway. 

Subway: For the Orange Line, take the Route 430 bus from Saugus to Malden Center. For the Blue Line, take local bus Routes 110, 116, 117, 411, 429, 441, 442, 455 or Inner Express Routes 426W, 448 or 449 to Wonderland Station. Monthly Inner Express Bus pass valid for travel on subway and local bus. 

For more information on alternate routes and construction, visit www.mbta.com/tobinbridge
attributes.header: Beginning Monday, April 1, expect major delays on Routes 426 & 428 due to lane closures in both directions on Route 1 in Chelsea and the Tobin Bridge. Riders are advised to seek alternate routes, especially during peak hours. MBTA.com/tobinbridge

attributes.description:
From April 8 through May 10 (except April 15), the Braintree Branch Shuttle will run Monday through Friday, starting at 8:45 PM. This diversion is part of the Wollaston Station improvements. Learn more about the project here: www.mbta.com/wollaston

Riders may experience up to an additional 15 minutes of travel time. All buses and stops are fully accessible.

Affected stops:
North Quincy
Quincy Center
Quincy Adams
Braintree
attributes.header: Bus shuttles replace Red Line train service between North Quincy and Braintree stations on weeknights at about 8:45 PM from April 8 through May 10 (except April 15). MBTA.com/wollaston
attributes.short_header: Bus shuttles replace Red Ln train service between N Quincy & Braintree on weeknights at about 8:45pm from Apr 8 through May 10. MBTA

attributes.description:
Following the name change of a municipal roadway in the vicinity of the station, the MBTA selected Lansdowne as the station's new name. 

Passengers should note that the name change has no effect on commuter rail schedules.
attributes.header: Effective Monday, April 8, Yawkey Station on the Framingham/Worcester Line will be renamed Lansdowne Station.
attributes.short_header: Effective Monday, April 8, Yawkey Station on the Framingham/Worcester Line will be renamed Lansdowne Station.

attributes.header: Route 109 experiencing delays of up to 20 minutes due to traffic
attributes.short_header: Route 109 experiencing delays of up to 20 minutes due to traffic

attributes.description: This additional trip address some of the crowding caused by the new spring schedule. Further schedule improvements with more added morning trips will be implemented with the Summer 2019 schedule.
attributes.header: A new weekday inbound trip at 7:53 AM has been added from West Medford to Haymarket until June 21, 2019.
attributes.short_header: A new weekday inbound trip at 7:53 AM has been added from West Medford to Haymarket until June 21, 2019.

attributes.description: To access the station, please use the main entrance on Savin Hill Avenue by exiting the parking lot and turning right to go up the hill to the main entrance. Please contact a station personnel for assistance.
attributes.header: Savin Hill Elevator 947 (Sydney Street to unpaid lobby) unavailable from Mon Apr 8 through Tue Apr 9 due to maintenance
attributes.short_header: Savin Hill Elevator 947 (Sydney Street to unpaid lobby) unavailable from Mon Apr 8 through Tue Apr 9 due to maintenance

Red Line
attributes.header: During the construction at Quincy Center, use Hancock Street to pick-up or drop-off passengers. MBTA.com/southshore

attributes.description:
Outbound connections can be made at:
Main St @ Higgins (temporary stop)
Main St @ Mayberry Ave
Main St @ Harvard St
Main St @ Bowen Ave
Main St @ Hancock St
Main St @ Hancock Ave
Main St opp George St
George St @ Main St
College Ave opp Frederick Ave (temporary stop)

Inbound connections can be made at:
College Ave @ Frederick Ave (temporary stop)
George St @ Main St
Main St @ George St
Main St @ Stearns Ave
Main St @ Windsor Rd
Main St @ Wellesley St
Main St @ Princeton St
Main St @ Harvard St

Missed stops:
Broadway @ William St (outbound)
Broadway @ Alfred St (outbound)
Broadway @ Boston Ave - Ball Sq (outbound)
Broadway @ Pearson Rd (outbound)
Broadway @ Warner St - Powder House Sq (outbound)

College Ave @ Dearborn Rd (outbound)
College Ave @ Boston Ave (outbound)
College Ave @ Professors Row (inbound)
College Ave @ Powder House Sq (inbound)

This detour is expected to be in place for approximately 1 year as the Broadway Bridge in Ball Square is reconstructed.

For more information, visit https://www.mbta.com/glx
attributes.header: Effective March 22, Route 80 is detoured long-term due to Broadway Bridge construction for the Green Line Extension project. MBTA.com/GLX
attributes.short_header: Effective March 22, Route 80 is detoured long-term due to Broadway Bridge construction for the Green Line Extension project. MBTA.com/GLX

attributes.description:
Due to expansion construction at the Wellington Carhouse, trains in both directions will share a single track through Wellington Station from start of service on Saturday, April 6, through end of service on Sunday, April 7. 

Please allow extra time for your travels. Regular boarding will resume with the start of service on the following Monday morning.

Affected stops:
Wellington
attributes.header: Please board both Oak Grove- and Forest Hills-bound trains on the northbound (Oak Grove) platform at Wellington during the weekend of April 6 - 7.
attributes.short_header: Please board both Oak Grove- & Forest Hills-bound trains on the northbound platform at Wellington during the weekend of Apr 6 - 7
